{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3749119,"name":"Hitendra Bedacie","username":"HitendraBedacie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-26T23:13:42.689Z","cooked":"

Hey there!, this preseason, our team has been trying to strenghten our localization tenfold, as the season before was the first season localizing. I’ve encountered an issue where im stumped and would love some assistance.

On our robot we use a limelight 3 on an apriltag pipeline with a Megatag 2 code setup. Using this code looking at tag 7 and trying to establish robot pose the robot establishes a pose thats pretty much there, except for the fact that the robot pose from mt2 shifts across the field when we are rotating the robot, as seen in the video.

The limelight is mounted on the back of the robot with a yaw of 180, both robots we’ve made with a limelight having that yaw pose has been shifting, i dont know if its relevent but i felt it was necessary to point that out. If anybody has any suggestions i would be eternally grateful. Thank you

CodeRepository.

heres the videos Video 1. Video 2

IMG_93621920×1646 227 KB

HitendraBedacie:

back of the robot with a yaw of 180

Your photo of the LL screen doesn’t reflect your stated LL mounting position. And the videos are Access Denied so I didn’t look at them.

I’d verify that the units that Elastic wants are the units that you are sending it. I couldn’t find what you are sending to Elastic so I don’t have any better suggestion than that. I do know that some of the units coming from the LL are not what AdvantageScope requires and maybe Elastic is a similar case and you picked the wrong LL function for Elastic.

What does the LL dashboard MegaTag localization screen show for the robot position?

Im assuming the screen you are talking about is the limelight position setup, the robot looks good, it sees the tag on the back of the bot and moves or moves around it just fine, depending on which mode i choose to see it in

the robot pose on elastic comes from the Drivetrain Pose, Because i Use the poseEstimator to throw in the mt2 estimate.

It seems that line 40 in your VisionSubsystem.java, which publishes the yaw to the limelight, is commented out. Uncommenting that should fix things.
